Idempotent: Repeated requests with the same parameters result in the same state of the resource. For instance, deleting a file is idempotent because once the file is deleted, subsequent delete requests don't change the state.
Safe: The method doesn't alter the state of the resource; it's essentially read-only.
Has Body: Indicates whether the HTTP method typically includes a message body. For example, POST requests often include data to be processed by the server.
